Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business in the north-end”
Reviews.Author: EFLMontreal
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for one night, in preparation for a business meeting in the neighborhood. The hotel itself is very nice, especially the reception area. It is surprising to find a hotel so big and luxurious in an area where is it surrounded by Tim Horton's and fast food restaurants. The room was perfect, very large and clean. The bed-linen was heavenly. The two-headed shower was a neat touch. The front-desk personnel was very nice and helpful for a health issue my co-traveller had. It's a perfect spot if you have business in the area or use a car to travel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but the price (especially for the location) just does not work”
Reviews.Author: Robert5635
Reviews.Content: So I stayed at this hotel on february 29th and while the hotel is nice and that the room was good, "the value for the buck" is just not there. Over $200 for a regular room in the Northen part of Toronto is just not worth it. There was 5 of us from my company there (I didn't make the booking) but I can tell you that this will not be our choice next time in town (only based on the price)

Reviews.Title: “Very average for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveller99
Reviews.Content: One night at the Westin Prince in Toronto. To be fair, this is a suburban hotel but still, not quite up to my usual Westin expectations. The good: Reasonable rate, and the room was large with nice windows and view. Business center was helpful. The not so great: when I arrived (albeit early check in), they sent me to a room that had not been cleaned (I Hate that, just kills the magic of staying in a hotel when you know someone else was there before you), restaurant (service and food were just ok, I ate there twice) and decor in the room looked very dated. Heavenly bed was not up to the usual standard in terms of bedding and comfort. Overall adequate for a short business stay, but I wouldn't want anyone to have this property set their view on Westin overall.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: musicmansimpson
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is solid, and is typically pretty good value. Some people complain about the location, but what I like about it is that you typically can't get a hotel of this calibre outside of a city's downtown core or airport. They have done a nice job with the renovations in the lobby level (although I wish there was a TV at the bar so that I'm not relegated to the annex (little room off the side of the bar with a few TV's). True -- some aspects of the room are a bit tired or dated, but it's still very clean and comfortable, and the rooms are among the most spacious in Toronto -- particularly the bathrooms. In terms of the local area, you've got quick access to the DVP and the 401, and there are lots of restaurants in the area -- a new pub across the road, a really cool area at the Shops at Don Mills, and plenty of other things in the neighbourhood. True, better if you have a car. But I work downtown, and I thought the bus service to Don Mills station and then the subway downtown was more than adequate, and no longer than driving down the DVP or bayview in traffic. All in all i like this place (although I miss the bar on the lower level), and I think it is good value for the product one receives. This hotel is rarely over $200, and most of the time you can get it for $160 or so. Good luck finding another Westin in a large city with a better price than that.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable & clean”
Reviews.Author: londoner1964
Reviews.Content: I would by no means say this is the best hotel I've ever stayed at but it was suitable for our needs and the location that we needed to be in. We ordered room service which arrived very quickly, was hot and presented exactly as ordered. We also enjoyed drinks at the lobby bar which was again ok and averagely priced. Parking is somewhat cumbersome but normal for Toronto. I would recommend this hotel for a short stay but don't expect too much from it

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: noboston
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel just one night only, as I was looking for a hotel to stay. This hotel is in the north east end of Toronto, so if you are someone that wants to tour around downtown Toronto area, this is not the hotel to stay in. The hotel is very nice, and clean. I didn't use any of the amenities, however, the room is spacious and the bed is one of the most comfortable beds I slept in. Nice big, puffy pillows and duvet, I felt like I was sleeping on a cloud :) There are little restaurants around, but like I said, it's a hotel located in mostly a residential area, so unless you are planning to be around the north east end of Toronto, this is a mighty fine hotel to stay in. There's a five star restaurant right beside the hotel, apparently I heard it's pretty good. That's all I have to say about this, sorry that I couldn't say much more.

Reviews.Title: “Average...”
Reviews.Author: CindyZX
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel because it was close to my friend's place. The location was not that convenient if you didn't drive. It takes about an hour to go downtown (bus + subway). Too bad that they don't offer shuttle from airport. You have to get a taxi to go there, which is insanely expensive! I called before my arrival to ask about the best way to travel from the airport to the hotel, I hated it when they say "you HAVE TO get a cab." They still charge for internet - $10 a day, but I think you get the first two hours for free? I only used internet for once and the package I got was only 2 hours and I didn't get charged for that. The lobby was fabulous, the room was a bit outdated tho. Staff members were helpful

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not fabulous either”
Reviews.Author: heatherall
Reviews.Content: We were only here for one night. The lobby looked really nice, and staff was very friendly. Our room was on the 8th floor. It seemed a bit outdated, but the bed was comfortable, had a well stocked minibar, and the bathroom was small but nice.My only real complaint about the room was that the sliding patio door wouldn't close tightly at the very top. It was a very windy night, and the wind was coming right in, blowing the drapes and everything. Thankfully the heat in the room worked very well. Self parking was $11. We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't say anything about the food there, but there are many restaurants to choose from nearby. All in all not a bad stay.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: willing292
Reviews.Content: we stayed here due to it's proximity to some stores we wanted to shop at. when a snow storm hit, we decided to stay for another night. beautiful view, would be very nice in a warmer season with it's extensive green area. will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great service”
Reviews.Author: CA_Traveler_1818
Reviews.Content: Spacious, clean and well-appointed rooms, comfortable beds, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service Overall”
Reviews.Author: Dankle4
Reviews.Content: I am a gold SPG member, and have stayed at this property approximately 10 times this year. The lobby of this property has been renovated and looks amazing, as do the restaurant and bar. The rooms themselves are a little bit outdated, but even with the rooms being a little bit dated, you still get an extremely comfortable bed, flat screen tv's, and nice washrooms. The staff overall is phenominal (with a couple exceptions). On the positive side, Tyson is always by the door, ready to greet you with a smile and make you feel welcome. Jennifer at the front desk goes above and beyond to ensure you feel like you are at home, and will do everything she can to make your stay enjoyable. The rest of the staff are very friendly, but these two in particular epitomize what hotel customer service should be, and truly are one of the main reasons I continue to stay at this hotel. On a recent stay, I had several issues, which I had to escalate in order to get resolved. Beware of dealing with Azar (spelling might be off). He is lacking in customer service skills, and makes no effort to understand a customers point of view. He is hostile and will not be of any use in attempting to resolve your issues. Fortunately, his superior, Kevin McFadden, I believe the Guest Service Manager, has been nothing short of amazing. Kevin takes the time to understand your viewpoint, and will do everything he can to resolve any issue. My only other negative experience with a staff member was with George, who delivered room service. We received a salad from room service that was horrible, and sent it back. He was extremely rude in taking it back, and muttered profanity under his breath. Aside from that salad, the food is very good. The business center is lacking a little bit, as they have 2 computers, only 1 hooked up to a printer, and they are extremely slow. I always travel with a computer, but I needed to print and use their computer for this, and it took 10 minutes for what should have taken 1 minute. The internet also seems to be a little bit slow On the bright side, they provide free wireless internet for Gold/Platinum members. Back to the positive, this hotel is a warm, comfortable place to stay, with staff second to none. I won't let 2 bad apples ruin the experience there, as all the other staff make up for the negatives of 2 people. I will continue to stay at this hotel, and know that I feel like I am a valued customer. Thanks Jennifer, Kevin, Tyson and Lydia for helping make your hotel feel like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Staff in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: steph132
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at the Westin Prince Hotel in Toronto for a second time. The first time my boyfriend and I stayed there, it was for his work Christmas party and we had a lovely time. I thought that it would be hard to top that stay - however, Ashok (the hotel Manager) and his staff completely topped our stay this year! From the time that we booked our room until the time that we left the hotel, everything was amazing. They spared no effort in making sure that we were completely comfortable in our room and they made themselves fully available for anything that we needed. Additionally, the party that took place at the hotel was lovely and elegant and the meal was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service -Tired Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mafism
Reviews.Content: The common areas were gorgeous and newly renovated; and the service was great. The room (a corner room) was a little rundown and surprisingly the bed was old and not â€œHeavenlyâ€�, they should out some thought in changing the bed as it ages, and the sheets were not as smooth as I would like and a little rough. They serve Starbucks in the hotel, but a tall cup cost $4.52 which seems a little steepâ€¦ Internet and parking costs over $25â€¦ Otherwise the hotel is clean and the service is greatâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Still charge for internet !!!”
Reviews.Author: HikerMom58
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel perfect for a weekend away...got a deal on-line internet access was $10 per day! thought that charging for internet went the way of the dodo bird. ( we just went over to Starbucks across the street) They also charged for parking in their spacious lot..so much for a real deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Torquay102010
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind staying outside the center of Toronto, I would recommend this hotel. It's only a $3 subway ride (including bus transfer) to downtown, and you don;y have to deal with parking. Rooms were spacious and welcoming. My husband and I received a "birthday special" - first night at regular rate, 2nd night you only pay the last 2 digits of you birth year! So do look for specials at the hotel - especially at off-peak times.

Reviews.Title: “OUR HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: BOBORTIZ
Reviews.Content: we travel extebsively on business to boston and toronto, and in toronto, we just love the westin prince hotel on york mills road. the front desk manager kevin mcfadden is most helpful along with tania yuen. roberto in the dining room is very knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: StefanLisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Westin Prince Hotel for a week while in Toronto on business and overall the experience was pretty good. The room we had was quite nice, clean and quieter than some hotels we have stayed at. The bed was extremely comfortable and the dual shower head in the bathroom was very relaxing. The staff were very friendly and helpful when we asked about restaurants that were close to the hotel. The hotel is also fairly close to a decent sized shopping mall. There were a couple of things we did not like about the hotel. The lighting in the front of the hotel and in the parking lots is rather dim and insufficient. There were a couple of areas where you were walking almost in total darkness going from the front doors to the parking lot area and if it is a rainy night, it is even worse. If you are traveling and you have multiple electronic devices that are online capable, the hotel does have Wi-Fi in the rooms but you are paying a daily premium for that online connectivity and will have to pay that fee for each and every device you want to connect to the Wi-Fi (laptop, iPad, iPhone, BlackBerry, etc). I guess we are just used to staying at some of the hotels in the USA where the Wi-Fi is free in the hotel and you can connect multiple devices to it.

Reviews.Title: “Two visitors from Ottawa”
Reviews.Author: MarySOttawa
Reviews.Content: We were first-time guests at this suburban Toronto hotel, which is remarkably quiet and very comfortable. Unlike most hotels, it has windows that open! We were given a high room, on a corner, with a beautiful southwestern view over the city. The service was top notch, from beginning to end, and all amenities that we tried were excellent - particularly the room service. The food was piping hot and delicious. The only difficulty we had was with the internet, which we were surprised to find was not included in the room rate. The location is actually very practical, even for access to the downtown, via public transit or the Don Valley Parkway. We were in Toronto to visit a patient at the Sunnybrook Hospital, which is also nearby - and the staff couldn't have been kinder. We'll be recommending this hotel to others, and we'll be back ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: RonyDebnath
Reviews.Content: Over all experience is good. Room comes with moderate cost. Restaurant service is excellent. I think it's one of the prime choice for the people to stay in Westin. Couple of times I couldn't get the accommodation that definitely proves the preference of staying in this hotel. Stay becomes more enjoyable when one become the Platinum Privilege member under SPG.

Reviews.Title: “Old worn down place”
Reviews.Author: JackcookOntario
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks lovely on the outside but is poor on the inside. Tired worn out rooms and hallways. No shower gel only bar soap!!! I asked for one shower gel as I don't use bar soap on my skin and was told that they don't provide shower gel to people on my floor! Oh great... what am I? Steerage class? I felt very insulted. Worst bar I ever visited. They completely ruined my strawberry daiquiri. No shuttle service to Pearson International airport and the taxis in Toronto are outrageously expensive...the highest tariffs in the world. No decent places to eat in the vicinity. I found the best place to be the gourmet pizza joint across the street. But this is not a hotel to justify the Westin name. You're better off at Holiday Inn any day of the week!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Very Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ashok S
Reviews.Content: Very good location, good room with comfortable beds and recommend to other travellers particularly if driving. It is easy to get to downtown. The Hotel is very good and the staff were all very eager to help. A. Sardana

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, location not so good”
Reviews.Author: toantarticaandbeyond
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. Not a good location for tourists. Comfortable rooms. Enjoyed teppenyaki at the Japanese restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Re-model of 70's Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJJC_Family
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here. The room was big and square-shaped, unusual. It gave it a spacious feel. The bed was very comfortable and that is always a selling point for us. The older I get the less tolerant I am of a lousy night's sleep. On the road, I need sleep to be functional. So a very comfortable bed is appreciated. The bathroom was good, but the shower was funky. At first, I thought the location was not very good, but I came to like it after I realized how many restaurants were within walking distance, despite the fact it was in the suburbs. The hotel is set back maybe a 1000 feet from the street making the hotel quiet. It's a business-oriented hotel and it has a very large lobby with a pleasant restaurant. The breakfast buffet had a greater variety and was of good quality, harkening back to days of yore ( although the first time I went the food was a little stale as I caught it near the end of the session ). They had a nice gift shop that also had snacks and it was open at least 10PM. All in all, it's a very nice place to spend a few days in the Toronto area if you don't need to be downtown. The only reason I do not give it an excellent overall is that it has to be a little more on the wow side, but very good, in this case, is very good and I wouldn't hesitate choosing it if it suits your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights at the end of a three tour of Ontario. It made an excellent location for getting downtown; the transport links via bus and subway are easy to use and inexpensive. The hotel is excellent and the staff were all very eager to help and offer advice. The concierge always greeted us as we arrived and left. The room was comfortable and the facilities within the room were excellent. The restaurant provided us with a good choice of food and it all came well presented and enjoyable. The buffet breakfast is fabulous and you can eat as much as you want. When we came to leave, our flight wasn't until late afternoon and they happily stored our luggage for us whilst we went out for the day. We haven't stayed in a Westin hotel before, but if this is typical, we wouldn't hesitate to do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice north Toronto hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeisureLadyJ
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel and its' location but I can see why some reviewers don't - it is located at the top end of the city by highway 401. There are several restaurants and shops minutes from the hotel and a beautiful mall called "Bayview Village" less than a 10 minute drive away (there is an Indigo Bookstore, LCBO and lots of shops and several restaurants there). I actually like that it is away from the hustle and bustle from downtown and so close to the highway. With no traffic it is 25 minutes to the airport. The Westin Prince is situated on a beautiful, scenic plot of land (15 acres) with many trees and set back from the main street. This hotel has an "old school" feel to it and has been renovated extensively in the past 8 or so years. The lobby is elegant and sophisticated and gives the hotel a grand feel and the lobby bar is open and inviting. There is a Japanese restaurant called "Katsura" off the lobby that I did not go into. The outdoor pool area is quiet and surrounded by trees and is delightful to relax in (the pool itself is on the smaller size). There are tennis courts there as well as some sort of lawn bowling lanes. The gym is small but has all the necessary machines and weights to put in a decent workout. Seems like there is a lot of wasted space on the lowest level where the gym and pool area is. There is a little guest shop by the elevators with snacks, magazines and other things you need or would like for a short stay. This is the second time I stayed here and I requested a high floor with a view. I was given room 1108 which is a corner room facing Don Mills and the 401 and overlooking the pool, tennis courts, soccer field and some business buildings. There was a slight smell in the room (remedied by opening the sliding door which only opens 3 inches - I think this is ridiculous) and the carpet a little grungy. Mini fridge was well stocked. Nice big flat screen t.v. with great cable channels and movie selections. The room felt very business forward but was bright and airy and quiet despite being by the elevators. Nice, comfy king bed. Clean bathroom with nice amenities. Great room service menu, lots of selection and the "late night" and kids menu has fun selections. I ordered a salad and soup which were good but the salad was missing the apples and the bread was a little stale. The in room breakfast options are ridiculous - starts at $15.50 for a continental and up to $21.50 for a basic one. Ample parking but for a fee ($13 for overnight, self parking), good wi-fi ($9.95 for 24 hours). I paid $189 for the night. $1.00 per phone call for local calls plus .10 a minute thereafter (this is silly). I had an issue with the bathroom door which locked behind me. The initial maintenance call came about 15 minutes later but the door still could not be opened so I waited another 40 minutes before the second visit. As a result, I couldn't get fully ready for the event I had to go to and ended up having to leave the room while the maintenance staff was still there. When I got back, the doorknob was completely removed. There was no kind of amends made for the inconvenience. All in all a nice hotel in a nice part of the city (although there really aren't any other options for accommodations).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trek8000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past weeknd. The rooms are very nicely appointed and very clean. There was a wedding at the hotel but we heard nothing. Very quiet! People were efficient and ready to please. We will stay here again. Price was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Frank M
Reviews.Content: I was amazed by the location. There were problems with rooms. but, all together it was a great stay. We really enjoyed it. I would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Dreary”
Reviews.Author: mama0105
Reviews.Content: Stayed here frequently for business. Despite the renovations, the place still feels a bit dreary overall. Food is ok. Best choice in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with several drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Nancy S
Reviews.Content: While the Westin Prince was a nice hotel, it didn't really live up to the Westin's I have previously experienced. The lobby area was nice, but the rooms are very outdated and the building needs to be upgraded. Check in was speedy, although I was not happy when they put us right next to the elevator on a low floor, when I had specifically said this was our first time in Toronoto. We were further disappointed to learn that we had to pay for internet. In this day and age internet should be a room requirement, much like towels and housekeeping. Anyway, we did enjoy room service, as the food was delicious and service very friendly. Be warned that the breakdown on your bill is very complex and hard to understand! Another drawback is the fact that they make you pay for parking. It's ridiculous, as you are basically in the suburbs and twenty miles from downtown Toronto. We checked out the so-so pool area and found the jacuzzi to be one of the coolest ever encountered. The sauna was at least hot. We probably won't be staying at the Westin Prince on our next trip to Toronto, but if you're looking for a decent hotel in the heart of suburbia, check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great people”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: Staff were consistently helpful and pleasant Room clean and basic Property pleasing green with walking distance services Lobby bar enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Comfortable Beds.”
Reviews.Author: LBennett03
Reviews.Content: We were on a little getaway for a wedding, so selected the "Romance Package" at this hotel. The bed was very comfortable, the amenities were great and it was quiet. The package included parking, breakfast and champagne with chocolate covered strawberries. The Champagne was good (Yellow Tail) and the chocolate covered berries were fresh. The options available breakfast buffet was very good; it included items such as smoothies and an omlette station. The only slight disappointment was that for a "Deluxe Room", we found it a bit small. However, it was clean and comfortable. The view from the room wasn't the greatest (all you see are light industrial buildings) but the view from the first floor restaurant/breakfast area is very nice. Definitely recommend this hotel if you are staying in this part of the city and take advantage of a package deal if you can. Good value for what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, friendly staff, older hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snowbird409
Reviews.Content: The Westin beds are fantastic, and this hotel has them too. The staff was very friendly and prompt. The hotel is older and it shows somewhat. Nice japanese restaurant on site. Overall, a good value for business if you're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Abominable customer service”
Reviews.Author: Racquel P
Reviews.Content: I attended a wedding/family reunion in this hotel at the end of July, 2011. I flew in from California specifically for this event. Towards the end of the night, as I was watching people on the dance floor, the waiters have started cleaning up the tables. The waiter cleaning the table next to me splattered red wine on my silk gown. Since this was a black tie event, I was wearing a designer gown worth $4000. I reported this incident that same night it happened to the night manager named Argon. He then reported it to Kevin McFadden, the customer service manager, who then contacted the banquet manager about the incident. Angel, the waiter who splattered the wine on me, did report the incident to his manager per Kevin's investigation. So, there's no question that the incident happened and it was their employee who was at fault. During the first week after the incident, I had telephone conversations with both Kevin McFadden and Azhar Kheraj, Kevin's assistant. They told me to get the dress cleaned and that we will discuss compensations after it has been established that the stain cannot be removed. Kevin never bothered to inform me that he was going to be on vacation starting the following week for 10 days. On August 9, I emailed Kevin and Azhar pictures of the dress with a note from the cleaner that the stain will not come out. I waited for a response from either of them but nobody bothered to respond. I called the hotel on Friday, August 12th and spoke with the front desk person. I left my contact number so that I may be called back and yet, no phone call again. On Saturday, August 13th I left a voicemail for both Azhar and Kevin and, guess what?, no response again. I finally spoke with Azhar on Tuesday, August 16th and only then was I informed that Kevin was on vacation for 10 days and that he will be back the next day. He told me that nothing can be done until Kevin comes back because he would have to make the ultimate decision on the matter. The next day, Azhar called me and said that there is no way they were gonna pay for my dress. He offered me a free one night stay with spa. I said that that's unacceptable because I'm not going to fly all the way to Toronto for that one night stay. So, I then contacted Sarah Pereira, executive assistant in the hotel. When I spoke with Sarah, I told her the situation and she said she was willing to work with me. I then receive an email from her a couple of days later and she gave me a deadline (10 days after the email) to submit a receipt for the dress. Of course, the dress was bought 3 months earlier and I didn't have the receipt. Furthermore, the dress was charged to my sister's credit card because she paid half of the dress as a birthday present for me. Also, I could not make the deadline because I'm due to leave the country for a couple of weeks and won't be back till 1 week after the deadline. So, a couple of days later, I called Sarah back and told her of the situation. She said she'll talk with somebody else and email me "shortly". Of course, I didn't get an email from her until after I emailed her late the next day for an update. Basically, she said that since I cannot provide the receipt within their deadline then the investigation is closed. I feel that the staff dragged this issue on unnecessarily. The fact of the matter is that thier waiter spilled wine on me and the stain cannot come out. Their waiter even admitted his fault. My dress is ruined. And with regards to Sarah, Kevin, and Azhar, none of them ever called or emailed back when they said they would. I had to keep on tracking them down which was very unprofessional of them. And, how is it okay for Kevin to go on vacation, not inform me, had me keep on calling the hotel waiting for an update and think it's okay? And now that it's my turn to go on vacation, I don't get the same courtesy from these people? Meanwhile, I let them know in advance of my situation. Doesn't seem right, does it? I have been a Starwood Preferred Guest Member for many years now. I have stayed at numerous Westin hotels in many cities. I must say, this hotel's customer service is abominable and that I have never been treated so disrespectfully. I just cannot believe that they would manipulate the situation to their advantage even though they've admitted that this was their staff's fault from the very beginning.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive property and outstanding service ... my 1st choice for Toronto business stays”
Reviews.Author: jipbits
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Westin Prince Toronto hotel since the extensive renovations were completed and from the moment of arrival, I enjoyed every aspect ... from the excellent service and attention provided by Brittany at check-in and throughout my stay, the quality of the rooms, the elegance of the lobby and common areas including restaurant/bars, the great exercise facilites and pool area, expansive grounds and convenient location ... all at competitive rates ... my experience was first class! I am making this property my 1st choice for all future Toronto business and personal stays.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had used this hotel sooner”
Reviews.Author: parisamsterdam2007
Reviews.Content: We are sometimes in Toronto to visit family and find it more convenient to stay in a hotel. than to impose on our relations. I wish we'd discovered the Westin Prince on earlier visits as it's only 10 minutes by car from our family. Our check in was fast and pleasant... we used Priceline's NYOP ($98 US) and were cheerfully allowed both an early check in and a choice of room configuration. Our king bed room was large and clean with a small balcony. The TV was a big flat screen and the bed was very comfortable. There was a huge desk that made using the laptop a breeze. Internet was not free but a relatively reasonable $11 for 24 hours. I have been charged more elsewhere. If your focus is on places and attractions near downtown this hotel might not be for you... but if you need to be in the Don Valley/York Mills area you won't do better.

Reviews.Title: “perfect spot for family weekend!”
Reviews.Author: lala_w_11
Reviews.Content: My Husband and our two children recently stayed at the westin prince hotel. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous. The lobby is very spacious and clean. My family and I we able to enjoy the pool and tennis courts during our stay, which is great that we didn't have to go far to enjoy the outdoors. I found the rooms to be very clean and the beds to be amazing...the best sleep I have ever had away from home!!!! I strongly suggest this hotel if you are looking for something away from the crazy downtown atmosphere. It is surrounded by beautiful greenery and is close to a variety of restaurants. This hotel made our family getaway very memorable, we will surely be back to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “good hotle, but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: CHRnLAURlikeTOxplr
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 5 nights and had a good stay overall, but would not say it was great value for money. The room on the 9th floor was very nice and large. It was also clean, but the cleaners were not great - they knocked on our door at 8am, so I put the do not disturb sign out from then on. They also didn't fully complete our room clean on one day, leaving the pillows uncased and another day only leaving one towel. The worse part really was that you had to pay $11 per day for parking, which considering it is no where near the centre of Toronto seems expensive. We also stayed at another hotel 10min drive north during our stay and parking was free there. I had a warning from here that parking would be payable, but I still resented paying for it and at such expense. I would probably recommend trying better value for money hotels before this. The outdoor pool and the gym looked very nice, but we didn't try these. Around the corner there is a Tim Hortons we used for breakfast, there are also loads of other places to eat, a pizza hut, wendys, kelseys etc.

Reviews.Title: “Miles from nowhere and sky-high prices”
Reviews.Author: Blizzardave
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice property. The place is very clean and well-kept. The design is stylish and innovative. It's also convenient to the Trans-Canada Highway. The staff are accommodating and knowledgeable. There are two drawbacks to this property. Firstly, it's miles from nowhere. Anywhere you need to go, you either have to have a car or take a cab. Nothing of import is within walking distance. There's a small strip mall about a half mile down the road but that's pretty much it. There is bus service to the front door but if you want to get downtown, say, it's almost an hour by transit. Secondly, a stay at the Prince will cost you a princely sum. If they have a room for under $200 a night, I've never seen it. Most rooms are about $250. Some of the good news is that there's plenty of easy parking and there are a couple of nice restaurants/bars with fine ambiance, good service and reasonable prices. All in all, it's a nice place to stay if you have friends or family in the area or if you need to get on and off the highway fairly quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good customer service but with a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: cwynj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a business mecca. It seems like 99% of the clientele seems to be travling on business/visiting head offices etc. Overall, a professional "vibe" and atmosphere. The lobby area is nice and up-to-date but the carpets on the guest floors as well as the wall-paper and some of the furniture was in very poor shape and not up to Westin's usual standards. The beds are very comfortable, but the Internet charge is a bit much, especially for a hotel that caters to so many business guests. I got a chance to use the fitness centre and it was decent; I love the fact that it is open 24/7! The service that I encountered was very good overall. The check-in was top-notch and rooom service was always good as well. I do wish that there was a bigger selection though. My biggest issue was when a wake-up call was not scheduled for me, causing me to sleep in an extra thirty five minutes. The hotel did send me a voucher for a free breakfast (dine-in only) but I was checking out early the next morning. I would have much preferred to be able to use that on room service as well. I was there for a week and there are definitely a few areas that could be improved but I am giving them another shot and have booked my next trip to Toronto there again in September.

Reviews.Title: “Good reminder of why I don't stay at Westins”
Reviews.Author: Golfer88
Reviews.Content: As a value seeker, I usually avoid Westin hotels. We stayed at the Westin Prince cause we couldn't find anything else reasonable in metro Toronto. But then, of course, they whack you with the extra charges. The place is out in the middle of nowhere with several football fields of open parking lots out front. So, they charge $11 for parking. Then, no free internet connection. Every time a clerk tells me that their internet connection isn't free, I am reflexively rude and sarcastic. Like it's their fault! Then I feel bad. So the Westin always makes me feel bad. When we had problems with local ATMs, they offered $88 for a $100 American bill. The exchange rate was $95. I don't mind a little service charge, but geez. Decent room, comfortable bed, excellent shower, nice big pool, decent little gym. Very helpful and friendly concierge. Way, way out from downtown Toronto. Fifteen minute drive or longer bus to the metro, then a 20-25 minute trip downtown. But decent restaurants, particularly Casa Manila, within walking or easy driving distance.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered and Primped at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: flygirl75
Reviews.Content: On our second visit to the Westin Prince, we recently had probably one of the best hotel experiences to date. We checked in quite late and had been given an upgrade to the Penthouse. This worked out very well because my infant daughter was with me and the PH has two separate rooms. The room was very well-maintained and no detail was left unnoticed. From the mini sewing kit in the bathroom to the complimentary Naya bottled water, the Westin Prince has one thing as a goal: keep the customers happy! I recommend this hotel if you are looking for a place accesible by highway (the 401 is very close but not too close). The Shops at Don Mills are a short drive away offering you a fantastic shopping experience. I also recommend this hotel to people who want to be away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Toronto. Lastly, the outdoor pool is a large size and they have pool toys (which is always appreciated when you have kids). The only small complaint that I have is that the water was ice cold and a little dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: arod12345
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Toronto to meet friends over the long weekend and stayed at the Westin â€“ cheap and luxurious felt like a hidden gem. The first night we dined at Katsura and although it was pricy it was a great experience, the next morning we had breakfast which offered a great variety in comparison to other hotels J I must comment on the level of service offered â€“ right from valet to the room attendant they all smiled and made us feel welcomed. Plus the outdoor pool was awesome and although it was a bit crowded on Saturday one of the best. Only negative point no free internet and the printer in the lobby level did not work! Tip â€“ ask for an upgrade upon checking in.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel but far from everything”
Reviews.Author: Colin3160
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel for a family wedding. Its a very good hotel, clean and well maintained but very far from any of the action. Be prepared to spend a lot of time at the hotel. Parking is $11.00 per night in an open parking lot. Food is expensive and drinks and also very pricey. The rooms are nice, nothing fancy but clean. The beds were not comfortable. I used the pool twice. It was dirty on both occassions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the family”
Reviews.Author: Woodjeff
Reviews.Content: As a kid living in Don Mills I remember when the Prince was being built (early 70's), and I even went there for the opening festivities. But, I had never stayed there until last week. My 2 teen daughters, my wife and I spent 3 nights there and it was a great experience. What a nice hotel. Friendly, helpful staff, clean spacious room and fine food in the restaurants. I brought my 84 year old Mom over for Sunday breakfast and that was great as well. I would prefer to see free parking and Wifi in the room. We will definitely stay at the Prince during future trips to North York in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay! Amazing service! It doesn't get any better than The Westin Prince!”
Reviews.Author: rfdali
Reviews.Content: My ONLY choice for hotel stays in Toronto is at The Westin Prince. My 18 year old daughter and I were attending a concert the evening of our arrival after a long road trip. We were greeted warmly by the assistant front desk manager who, as always, is one of the reasons that I go back to this hotel. She is always helpful, caring and treated us with special touches for our stay! The entire hotel staff looked after all of our needs. We were upgraded to a deluxe room, served a snack before we went out to the concert, and breakfast the next morning was divine with all wait staff ready to attend to our every request! Talk about being spoiled or what!! I will be back as soon as I can think of a reason to come to my 'home away from home' at The Westin Prince!

Reviews.Title: “amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren499262
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin prince and was extremely happy with the level of service I received.Â  The front desk manager checked us in on Friday night, and already knew that we were celebrating our 1st anniversary.Â  He got us an upgraded room facing downtown and sent us chocolate dipped strawberries to congratulate us.Â  The service here is wonderful -Â  we will definitely return again! I highly recommend booking on Priceline and asking to speak with a manager when you get to the hotel (he gave me his business card but I misplaced it â€“ he looks pretty young and wears glasses).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: justmads1
Reviews.Content: I booked two hotel rooms for my daughters 11 birthday celebration. The Assistant Front Office Manager not only booked my rooms for me, upgraded us to better rooms but also wrote my daughter a lovely birthday card and left a lovely plate of chocolate strawberries upon our arrival. Large rooms, great pool and work out facilities. Excellent customer serive offered! Breakfast buffet lovely! We DEFINATELY would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Caring staff”
Reviews.Author: asmabail
Reviews.Content: Westin Prince is a very comfy hotel, I had a wonderful stay there, I enjoyed the facility they have. Staff are all kind and caring. They looked after me well when I was sick on my first night stay. I only wished to have a wireless net free in the rooms to connect with the family. The location is very nice and had the wondelful greeny park in the back. The food was great the service was excellentI would definetely go back when I get the chance. Thank you all for your kind and generousty.

Reviews.Title: “Place to stay in North Toronto”
Reviews.Author: doublebzz
Reviews.Content: For anyone needing to stay in North Toronto, the Westin Prince is realy the best choice. Oversized rooms, complimentary internet in the lobby and convenient to major highways are major pluses. The greatest plus is an attentive and friendly staff. I forgot a dress shirt with expensive cuff links in my hotel room after I checked out and it was held for me in lost and found where a relative picked it up. I would certainly stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back”
Reviews.Author: tshissler
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that I have ever stayed at this hotel. My wife and I stayed there with our small child. The hotel was nice, and the staff was wonderful. I was slightly disappointed that the pool is closed, but overall our experience was wonderful. The hotel staff really went the extra mile.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a Westin”
Reviews.Author: steilkurve
Reviews.Content: Sure the staff was friendly and the rooms kind of clean but the facilities of this establishment are not really Westin-level. Aside from the lobby and the elevators which have been refreshed, the rest of the property looks quite tired. My room seemed clean but everything was just out of date. Late 70s style and colors, old worn carpet with that sticky feel, a mattress which was not up to the Heavenly bed standards, etc. The place felt more like a Radissson that needs a fix than a Westin. Came for business but will avoid if I can next time.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish centrally-located Toronto hotel in bucolic setting”
Reviews.Author: Eric451
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this centrally-located Toronto hotel with park-like grounds. From our room in the tower we had a stunning view of downtown Toronto and its environs. The room was large and decorated in the de rigueur of a four-star hotel:(neutral colors, flat-screen TV, fine linens, comfortable bed, dramatic lighting, spa-like bathroom, etc.) The public rooms of the hotel are even more stylishly and imaginatively decorated with a wall of windows on one side of the large restaurant facing a forested acreage. This venue was an ideal setting for several family events. The food was fine and the professionalism and warmth of the staff were impressive. Allison, the restaurant manager, was instrumental in the planning of my social events and they occurred without a hitch. My only complaints are the cold and damp Toronto weather and its congested traffic (tip: use public transportation). The Westin Prince Hotel will be my first choice, when I return to Toronto (hopefully the summers are warmer).

Reviews.Title: “Almost there”
Reviews.Author: RaleighSB
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent guest at this hotel, and have been so for years. In the past year or so the lobby area including restaurant was renovated resulting in a much better dining experience. However, I have a pet peeve that wines should be stored at proper temperatures and this ability was lost in the recent restaurant upgrade. Good red wines are stored at room temperature instead of a proper temp in a wine fridge. When paying CD $ 10+ per glass, one would expect more. Also, the former lounge was not renovated and sits vacant and one of the three guest elevator banks has been out of services the past couple of visits. Other than that the hotel is in a good locations, rooms are nice, and the staff is helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Meets the standard set by other Westins”
Reviews.Author: Arunda01
Reviews.Content: Meets the standard set by other Westin Hotels: modern, sleek common areas, rooms decorated with contemporary accents and polite service. The rooms were standard in the Westin Hotel family: the bed was of excellent quality and the bathrooms were modern As for the common areas: we did venture to the bar after dinner. I didn't like the layout much (but it's hard to ask for a lounge atmosphere in a hotel). The wine and drink selection were fine, but the service was a bit slow. As for other service (check out, wake-up calls): it was prompt, polite service. No complaints from me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good price for quality”
Reviews.Author: SomeGuy1027
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after cancelling a stay at another hotel that was unacceptable. The Westin Prince was very clean, and comfortable with nice amenities and good service. The additional $10 a night as compared to the other hotel we had booked at was some of the best money I have spent. Will stay here the next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: Megan555
Reviews.Content: The staff are very helpful and the rooms are large and bright! Went on a 2 night Getaway , and it was perfect! Parking only 11.00 a night! A little pricey but worth it! (You get charged for anything extra, Music, Internet, movies etc. and it adds up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve_the_nomad
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean hotel with friendly staff. I was there for three nights on business and was always greeted by the door man and reception staff. The fitness centre was well equipped. Room VERY clean, nice TV, room service was very fast and food was good. Happy to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but a bit faded”
Reviews.Author: Qingwa
Reviews.Content: The public areas of the hotel are great, the concierge were fantastic and friendly. However, I had a room with two double beds, a massive TV and a small bathroom. The decor felt a bit tired, but the room was clean and quite: I slept well. There are a few chain bars and coffee shops across the road which make a good change to hotel fair (Wonderpho does good Vietnamese food) and offer free wifi (hotel charges $10 a day). Though not Downtown, the hotel is a short bus ride from the subway into the City centre.

Reviews.Title: “What a Deal!”
Reviews.Author: jmrun1126
Reviews.Content: Usually we opt for Sheratons or Four Points Sheratons in the Starwood brand, but when we discovered the price of this Westin in Toronto, we booked it immediately. We were considering staying downtown, but we thought it wouldn't be much of an inconvenience to stay a bit outside of downtown, and we sure are glad (read below). When we arrived at the Westin Prince, we immediately felt like valued customers. Although not an elite Starwood Preferred member, the front desk attendant upgraded us to a junior suite for our two night stay on a high floor with a partial-view of downtown. Every staff member we encountered genuinely cared about us and was very friendly and courteous , especially the valet attendants. When we got to our room, we couldn't have been more impressed for the price we were paying. The heavenly-beds were truly heavenly, and the bathroom was elaborately furnished. The breakfast was a bit pricey, but worth it. Otherwise there is a Tim Horton's right next door and a few other options within walking distance. What was surprisingly most convenient about the hotel was its accessibility to the city via the TTC, Toronto's efficient, clean, and safe public transit system. In fact, for all of the attractions we visited (Science Centre, CN Tower, Old Fort York, Hockey Hall of Fame, etc.) we never once pulled our car out of the lot. Instead we walked to the bus stop at the foot of the driveway, boarded a bus, and within minutes were at the York Mills subway stop down the road, which connected us to anywhere and everywhere in Toronto. If you're comfortable using public transit, I'd highly recommend using the TTC and leaving your car in the lot to avoid the horrendous traffic, extreme parking fares downtown, etc. Downsides of hotel: Parking and internet are not free. But if you do pay for the internet, at least it is fast. We'll definitely return when in Toronto to avoid the high prices downtown and relax in this fabulous hidden gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our Christmas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jsingh89
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I selected the Westin Prince Hotel to stay at from Dec. 25 - Dec.28 2010. We wanted to have easy access to the downtown core and other parts of the GTA. The Westin is located on York Mills Rd and Don Mills, central to the DVP and 401 Hwys. Traveling north on Don Mills Rd you can find easy access to Fairview Mall, while travelling south on Don Mills Rd you can find The Shops at Don Mills and other restaurants. The Hotel has a beautiful lobby, and two wonderful restaurants, (the Katsura and the 900), and features a live pianist for dinner services. We stayed in the Deluxe King Suite, our room to look was decent, the heavenly beds are very comfortable, the carpet on the floor was a beige gone dark do to use and wear, and the colours on the wall were of a darkish beige, as you can imagine we used the table lights in the room because of the poor choice in wall colour. The washroom had a nice sink fixture however the heavenly shower that Westin advertises was ridiculously small. It is not comfortable to be showering, only to move, and have your buttom brushing the wall or doors as you move. And believe me it's not your weight, it's the shower size, I only weigh 135 lbs! Here is a summary of what we experienced to be our Pro's and Con's Pro's 1. The room service staff and house keeping staff are very friendly and helpful 2. Our special requests - being in a corner room - we're met 3. Accessibility in terms of location and where we wanted to travel too was met 4.The hotel is clean throughout its different rooms and levels 5. For me this is a pro, for others it may not be, The entire hotel is a Smoke Free Zone Con's 1. You PAY for Parking - $11/per car/per night, we had two cars 2. You PAY for Internet Access - they provide you with bundled options; we paid $35 for 3 nights - you can go to a motel 6 and get free internet access! In this day and age paying for internet at a hotel is truly pathetic! not to mention the speed of the internet was very poor! 3. Shower size is way too small in order to shower comfortably, and no you cannot take a shower with your Hubby or Wife, the two of you will not fit! 4. Refreshment Bar - That automatically charges you when you lift a bottle to see what the heck it is - Yes, thats right. I picked up a bottle to see what flavour it was only to read the sign that states, If you lift anything your account will automatically be charged! - Service express took care of the issue for me as I did not consume a bottle of Vitamin water for $15 bucks 5. The hotel is too pricey- Anything in the refreshment centre, from what I remember was not below $7. Its not like there bonus size cans of pop or candy bars, they're regular size. If you really want a can of pop or candy bar go to the connivence store or the Longos thats located 2 minutes away from the hotel =) 6. The paint choice and carpeting we're very poor and did not add any ambience to the room. 7. The pool is seasonal, so it was closed, instead they had a very Tiny Whirlpool. 8. There is no Spa at this Hotel - Your only choice for relaxation at this hotel is via the heavenly bed, and small shower. All in all, The Westin Prince Hotel is Not a Hotel I willing be staying at in the near future. I have stayed in various hotels for travel and business, anywhere from a single king room in a Motel 6 to MGM's Sky Loft. The Westin Prince Hotel is supposed to be a hotel, amongst others, towards the luxurious end of the scale, for myself, that is show cased most importantly in the living quarters of the guest. Unfortunately from my experience, I did not experience luxury nor did I experience a room that projected a warm ambience. The beds we're comfortable for a good nights rest, however that did not make up for the lack of room and comfortableness missing in the washroom, the lack of a spa, and access to a pool. I hope this review helps individuals out there looking for thee perfect place to stay, because the Westin at Don Mills and York Mills is Not the one at all. Cheers, and heres to wishing everyone a Happy New Year!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: nicesoot
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Boxing day of this year and had a fantastic experience from beginning to end! Gorgeous property and experienced and courteous starwood associates throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Made us feel like family!!!”
Reviews.Author: vandenheja
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were greeted by Ashok Baghel,General Manager at The Westin Prince Toronto and we were warmlly welcomed. He was aware my Mother was having surgery at Sunnybrook Hospital the next day and she was extremely anxious. He upgraded our room and told us if we needed anything we were to let him know. In our room we had complimentary fresh fruit, water and a personal note from him (nice touch). When we needed an extra set of guests towels -no questions asked and were promptly delivered. I have travelled all over the world have even stayed in a 6 star in Paris and am aware of what makes a comfortable, superior stay. Because of the personal touch and caring -this hotel in my books is a five star. No hesitation in recommending it to my travelling friends for whatever their purpose in Toronto may be.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, but fee for wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: OntarioTravel_mommie
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The staff was wonderful, the best faboosh, and the breakfast buffet, though $21.00, was awesome and the chef made me a spinach and feta omelet right there. My only negative thought was that I've stayed in much lower quality hotels, and the wi-fi was free. This is an nice hotel and there's a fee for wi-fi (and everything else). STRANGE!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable customer service and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: steph132
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend for his company work party. The hotel is in a great central location and is easy to get to. The hotel itself was beautifully decorated and immaculately clean. The staff were the best part of the stay. They were extremely accommodating and very helpful. In addition, the staff party was also executed perfectly. The banquet staff were efficient and attentive and the food was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: jimmybobTimmins
Reviews.Content: Have stayed twice at this hotel for a total of 8 days. Place is very clean, ALL THE STAFF EXTREMELY HELPFUL AND FRIENDLY. Food was great in the restaurant. Very relaxing atmosphere. Did not drive here, but had absolutely no problems taking the TTC. Really enjoyed the experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 123Carol
Reviews.Content: Two minor complaints: 1. the showerhead is way too low - I'm 6 feet tall and have to bend way over to wash my hair. 2. wireless internet is not free - it costs $10 per day. In this day and age I think they should offer it free.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at a great older hotel with great beds”
Reviews.Author: scottino84
Reviews.Content: This Westin wasn't build last year. Get over it. By the looks of the lobby and restaurant it has definitely been updated recently. When you walk in the lobby, you know you're in a high-class high-standards hotel. I don't know if every Westin is like this, but the lobby smells amazing. I think they pump in a scent. Whatever it is, it's delicious. The rooms can be a bit dated. That's what I mean by it not being built last year. They have been kept up and there are 42 inch tv's in the two different rooms I stayed in (I stayed there twice in two weeks). The beds are so incredibly comfortable - I wished I didn't have to get up and go to work. Internet costs extra unless you're an SPG Gold member like me. I ordered room service once and it was delicious. I also ate at the breakfast buffet and loved it. You definitely get what you pay for. In Toronto, this hotel is NOT downtown. Don't assume it is. There is a different Westin on the lake shore. For me, this hotel was perfectly located for where I needed to me. Make sure it is for you too. If it's close - it's definitely worth the drive to stay in such a great place. The staff were nothing short of excellent in any of my encounters. Even when something when slightly awry - my stuff got stuck in the locker in the gym - silly, I know. They were kind and efficient and resourceful to get it out, and even gave me a breakfast to make it up to me. The amenities, like the gym, were great too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel: Beautiful property, friendly staff, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: TheFloydSW
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin Prince a few times for business and though it is expensive, as a business hotel I think they know that most of their guests are staying at a company's expense. Therefore, they have gone all out in offering business-friendly ammenities. I really like the fact that it's in a quiet part of the city yet it's really easy to get downtown, (either by car or TTC). The staff is exceptionally friendly and efficient in all areas. Their banquet and conference facilities are absolutely wonderful as well. Dining options are good: Breakfast buffet is expensive but includes fresh made-to-order ommeletes and lots of other goodies. Guests have to pay for Internet but I recommend enrolling in SPG (their loyalty program). After a few stays at Westin and Sheraton hotels you get enough points to become a "Gold member", which means free internet and automatic room upgrades. A fair amount of money has been put into this property and when it comes to business traveling I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: barjil
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a business location it seems, away from the of the downtown core. The Lobby & restaurant were very clean & modern. The balcony was very small & in rough shape, maybe one person could fit standing, not that there was a view from our room anyhow. The beds were indeed "Heavenly". The "heavenly" shower...not so heavenly. I couldn't figure out how to work them both, I just couldn't find that darn button :S Not to mention there was no hot water either!!!! The bathroom was outdated with a modern sink. The other big issue here was that when we checked in at almost midnight. Within an hr. without any prior notice the water was turned off!! until 5 am. We needed to brush our teeth, shower & use the washroom which we couldn't until the morning. It was a big inconvience seeing as we just checked in when this occured. I feel that the staff should have notified us of this when we checked in. It was very embarrassing having to share a toliet all night without being able to flush, especially being a new couple on our first hotel stay together. The hotel did provide us though with 2 free bottles of water. Our t.v. was also not working, had to call maintence to fix a wire that came loose. Maintence was very speedy & friendly & got the job done. When we checked in we were hoping to grab a late night snack as we were starving. There were no food service in the hotel at this time nor were there any menus or phone books in the room to order in....Only a condom left in our bedside drawer: S Ick We requested a late late check out & upon check in we were honoured this, only to be awoken by housekeeping at 930am asking if we are checking out. We left at noon.

Reviews.Title: “Great updated hotel outside of the city core”
Reviews.Author: richbrianp
Reviews.Content: Just what I was looking for to spend a quiet night away with the wife. Beautiful hotel, nicely renovated, styled like a larger boutique hotel. Even outside of downtown you still need to pay parking but at a more reasonable $11 per night. And Katsura is right on site for some excellent if pricey Japanese meal.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean &Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Travel2971
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks old and worn out from the outside but it is fully renovated inside. It is modern, clean and fully equipment for business travel. The rooms where very clean and very kept. The restaurants are expensive but the food was pretty decent. If you are paying for your own food it may be more economical to eat somewhere else. If you are staying at this hotel to visit downtown Toronto you will be a good 30 min drive, stay somewhere else if thatâ€™s the case.

Reviews.Title: “ROOMS ARE DISGUSTING, LOBBY, RESTAURANT, BAR ARE GREAT”
Reviews.Author: ESTravelerFL
Reviews.Content: As soon as I pulled up in front of the hotel I was concerned. Great entrance, but the building is old and shows it. Then you step into this beautiful lobby/bar/restaurant area and I thought wow!!! Even the elevator was beautiful. THEN I got to the floor, old, dirty carpet and disgusting rooms. The rug in the 1st room was full of stains and smelled old and musty. I called the front desk and said there is no way I can stay in this hotel room. They moved me to a larger room, still old no smell and minimal stains on the rug. If it was not so late I would have left. The Mgr on duty sent up a nice note apologizing with a bottle of wine & cheese. The staff was excellent, just like the lobby/bar/restaurant/elevator. Whomever made the decision not to upgrade the rooms 1st was just like the rooms - old musty and on the wrong track.

Reviews.Title: “Its a Westin... of yore”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaSims
Reviews.Content: Lovely lobby, excellent park like setting, the rooms are dated Westin, drab off-green paint is depressing, 90's veneer colored cabinets past their due date, shower stall was tight, location is 30 mins from downtown Toronto (though only about a 12 mile drive) , Staff was absolutely wonderful however.. maybe the best I have encountered in Toronto, and food was good, and well priced, with breakfast looking into a forest which helped make up for the completely lack-luster rooms, of course the heavenly bed was nice, though the heavenly shower was a waste as the shower stall as tiny ..

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: sunnyboy9
Reviews.Content: This is the place we come back to everytime we visit Toronto. It has a park like setting yet not too sprawling like the Inn on the Park. The rooms are comfy enough in the Tower but still a bit tired in the Wing units. Front desk staff are really friendly which makes a difference when we fly long distance to Toronto. The dining place needs rethinking - it looks like a cross between a lounge/bar and a cafe. Instead they could make it a gathering place for simple nibbles with warmer and more inviting decor. All in, their one up over downtown properties is their park like more relaxed setting.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel well located.”
Reviews.Author: hockeytraveller-2010
Reviews.Content: Great service , very clean and extremely comfortable. Check the hotels site directly for special deals. Only downside, they charged me for outdoor self parking???

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: MissSoro
Reviews.Content: This hotel stay was comfortable and affordable. The "heavenly beds" they carry provided us with a restful sleep. The "heavenly showers" were also a nice feature of the room. The hotel was within walking distance to several restaurants, convenience stores and public transportation. The Ontario Science Centre and the shopping centers were both about a 10-15 min drive. The hotel was nicely decorated and the staff was very accommodating. The only thing I would say I did not enjoy was the daily parking fee. Overall, we had a very nice stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bathroom could be better for kids”
Reviews.Author: codgirl
Reviews.Content: Room was great- we got it at a discounted price so even better. Carpet was quite stained but I guess clean. Had to watch kids as there was a lot of stuff lying around that they charge you for touching. Bathroom sink was totally unreachable for an above average height three yearold Great location for science center and zoo. Lots of noise from other rooms on the saturday night

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel but could use a few upgrades”
Reviews.Author: riskable
Reviews.Content: I've probably stayed at over a hundred hotels in my lifetime and this is the first where I felt I should write a review. Why? It got me fired up with love and hate all at the same time (and I'm stuck in my hotel room waiting for a client to call me back =). Firstly, the great things: * This hotel has the best breakfast buffet I've ever experienced in my life. The cinnamon french toast I had on day 1 was so amazing I couldn't help but stuff myself silly with 2nds then 3rds! I also partook in some of their fresh-baked banana bread and, well, WOW. Amazing. The 2nd day I noticed that they had STRAWBERRY BANANA SMOOTHIES at the beverage area. Are you kidding me? I had two. Delicious! The orange juice was also delicious and was obviously NOT from concentrate (one of my hotel pet peeves is orange juice from concentrate--yuck!). Probably freshly squeezed. All you can eat delicious gourmet food for $14--not cheap but not too bad either. Think of it as a $10 buffet with $4 all-you-can-drink smoothies =) * The room: Pretty much par for the course except for the GIGANTIC LCD TV (nice) and their signature dual shower heads (which I tried and can't say it is worth the water waste but it *was* a neat feature). The mini snack bar is a bit scary... If you merely lift an item to look at it the thing will automatically charge your room (probably RFID-based). If I stayed here in the winter I'd be afraid of bumping the table when taking off my coat and winding up with $40 worth of snack charges. Now for the bad: * The room: With the exception of the halogen track lighting in the bathroom all lighting fixtures had old-school incandescent bulbs that were covered in so much dust they'd start to smell like, well, burning dust after a while. They have little cards everywhere talking about how they're trying to be "green" (don't use the extra shower head if you want to save water, don't put the card down to change the sheets, etc) then they have incandescent bulbs in all the fixtures!?! This just astounds me... The cheapest, quickest way to save a LOT of electricity is to switch to compact fluorescent bulbs. I haven't been to a hotel using old school energy-wasting bulbs in like 5 years now. Get with your own program Westin! The room #2: The door to the hallway was hollow and zero effort was taken to seal it in any way. This means you can hear every sound in the hallway as if you left your door open. I normally don't care about such things (most hotel goers are pretty quiet) but I could literally hear the sound of a person three doors down simply inserting their key card into the door (which is a nominally quiet action). The combination of hallways that amplify sound plus the non-existent soundproofing in/on/around the doors made for a very, er, intimate experience with the other hotel guests that were actually trying to be quiet. NOT COOL. Lastly... When I booked this hotel I got a corporate rate ($159) which is actually an amazing deal. However, the client had me move the check-in date forward one day and this resulted in a room price increase to $359/night! I didn't find out about this until the day I checked in at which point I complained and they "corrected" the rate. It all worked out for ME but I can't help but wonder how many travelers get completely screwed by such things. Westin needs to get a handle on their booking system to prevent things like this from happening in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is improving, our stay was (mostly) enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: COCOFromOttawa
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of Toronto's Westin Prince, a unique hotel property north of Toronto's core set in quiet, park-like grounds. Our family stays at The Prince regularly and, as I mentioned in my review last year, the hotel has been plagued by problems associated with recent extensive renovations and significant issues related to the abilities of a small minority of its staff. I'm happy to report that the renovations are progressing well and the lobby and public areas are updated and spacious. Hotel rooms, including ours, have not all been refreshed but ours was comfortable, spacious and well air conditioned. Hotel staff were super-friendly and helpful (only exceptions were our bored-to-bits-check-in-clerk and the obnoxious doorman who shouted at my husband for not using the revolving door and then for not using it properly). The horrible "automatic" magnetic trays with jars of candies in every room are really annoying -- this time my son grabbed a jar of "free" gummy bears before I could stop him -- but the front desk agreed to take them off our bill when we brought it to their attention - we didnt have to fight to have this done this like last year. Despite these experiences we had a nice stay including good long sleeps in our quiet room, the lovely breakfast buffet (kids are half price) and many swims in the outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but be aware of extras”
Reviews.Author: Worlwide
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, offering excellent value for money for anyone not wanting or needing to be downtown Toronto, but its charging policy leaves the client wary he is continually being ripped off. Staff at the check in desk were always pleasant, helpful and efficient, doubling much of the time as the concierge desk too. However the information on arrival that self-parking (and one really needs a car to stay here) in the huge lot that surrounds this suburban hotel was charged at $11/day, and that room wi-fi connection was an additional $9.95/day, both plus the high Canadian tax, left us wondering what else would be extra. Notices in the bedroom warn that if you touch anything in the mini bar it will automatically register a charge, and that the refrigerator should not be used for personal items. However separately there are glasses and a 750ml bottle of water, and an invitation to â€˜revitaliseâ€™. A nice gesture of welcome? No way! In tiny print at the end of the label I read that the water would be charged at $5.95. There are two paper cups, two tea bags and three individual coffee bags provided for guest use â€“ but beware, they come with a warning that additional supplies requested will be charged! The hotel has pleasant, spacious public areas, and has a gym, outdoor pool and hot tub. Our room in the tower was large, clean and comfortable. A note from management on the desk welcomed us to Spring in Toronto (it was August). The bed was large, and the room also has one armchair, a desk (but no writing paper), a flat screen TV, adequate drawer and wardrobe space and an iron and ironing board. The bathroom was small, but adequate, and a good hairdryer, one robe and a retractable clothes line are provided. A french window opens onto a narrow balcony, which allows fresh air into the room. Pity that the management has not considered using the balcony to access the outside of the windows to clean them! Inviting us to â€˜save the planetâ€™ the hotel offers a $5 voucher to spend in the hotel if one declines to have any housekeeping. Many hotels have ways in which guests can indicate that they do not want bedlinens or towels changed, but can still have the bedroom and bathroom cleaned and tidied, beds made, wastebaskets emptied and supplies replenished. This was not an option at the Westin, and maybe Iâ€™m wrong, but I couldnâ€™t help feeling that the aim was to save the hotel costs rather than help the planet. Breakfast in the restaurant was good, and good value, but again the hotel let itself down by penny pinching. When my husband questioned whether or not the orange juice was fresh as indicated on the menu, the waiter admitted that it was not, although it had been in the past. Dinner was not so good, but there are many restaurants in the immediate vicinity offering similar food at competitive prices. This could be a really good hotel and really good value. It should charge a little more, but include what almost every guest needs. Then guests can relax and enjoy the facilities instead of wondering what can be charged for next.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Rooms & Location”
Reviews.Author: lovealotbear2
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the location of this property. Easily accessible to many Toronto attractions without the hustle and bustle of downtown. It was pretty much 20 minutes to everywhere, which was perfect. Rooms were large and clean only downfall was the double beds instead of queens but were still comfortable. Free internet would have been nice. All in all, it was the perfect place to stay and would highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Suburban location, but available and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: rowingman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Prince, which is located a good 30-40 minutes from downtown by car in rush hour, given the pending G20 Summit which had consumed downtown hotel availability. The rooms are better than average Westin (in the tower portion at least) with a somewhat odd, but appreciated vestibule/double door system which mitigated any noise from the hallway. I had a corner on the 14th floor, with new desk/wardrobe/flatscreen TV unit, new carpet, new bed and head board. Much appreciated. View of downtown was good, although across a busy highway. The lobby restaurant was above average to good for a lobby bar/restaurant. The Katsura Japanese restaurant (part of the hotel) was average and not as good a value (sushi was good, but cooked entrees less so). Wine selection in the hotel bar/restaurant was better than average. This is a large hotel/conference complex, which has some signs of age, but the reinvestment occurring now is apparent in the renovated rooms and completely new lobby and lobby bar/restaurant. Would I take a vacation at this property? Probably not. Would I say it is adequate to a good place to stay for a couple days on a business trip? Sure, it is just fine, you will get your Westin amenities (bed, toiletries, SPG points) at a reasonable price. Annoyances are paid parking (in the suburbs it seems like a rip off, but maybe they do it because of the nearby highway downtown, perhaps it was used by commuters sharing rides, who knows?), lack of free wi fi in the lobby (the Hilton downtown gave me free wi fi for just asking, and I wasn't even staying there), and the showers are a bit small (I am slighly over 200cm and the shower heads are cramped in a small shower stall). Positives are an OK fitness center (OK, not fab), better than average restaurant in the lobby. Oh, and last annoyance, guests with dogs. Leave your dogs at home. I don't appreciate your little precious dog coming after me when I am on a business call trying to use the lobby PC.....

Reviews.Title: “Tired and sad”
Reviews.Author: Scalawag2188
Reviews.Content: The Westin Prince used to be a nice place to go, quality hotel with a couple of great restaurants if you didn't feel like venturing out. We were shocked at the change: the rooms were not just dusty and unkempt, they were FILTHY with dust everywhere and horrific spots on the rippling carpeting. They have institute a pressure-sensitive device for the "refreshment" area...i.e., if you move anything you get charged $25. I guess that's a testament to the type of people who stay there now. As for many hotels the breakfast buffet was usurious in price ($21) but it's either that or Timmy's next door. I asked about INternet and was told to go to the business centre in the basement and was charged $5 for 15 minutes; actually there was an Internet "cafe" on the main floor with 2 computers in it (1 for kids) that was free. Very sad.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for tourists who seek the quintessential Toronto experience”
Reviews.Author: Tejas1
Reviews.Content: If you are a tourist who has come to Toronto to take in the sights/attractions and benefit from the typical mass transit system present in a large metropolis to dart around, I would NOT recommend staying here (be forewarned to those folks in particular who bid 4-star on Priceline as the Westin Prince is one of the available hotels). This hotel is about ~30 - 45 minute drive on a commuter congested highway to downtown and you will need to rent a car (unless you have a hefty taxi cab budget). Otherwise, you'll need to rely on a network of bus, train, and subways, and three days later, you might arrive at your desired destination. If time is of the essence, as I imagine it is for most tourists, these are not appealing options. Although it is located in a sprawling suburban area where space is not an issue like it is in the downtown/financial district, they still charge guests $11 per day for parking privileges in their expansive lot.
