Not to be completely negative, the rooms are standard Westin in my estimation with the iconic Heavenly beds and robes. The lobby is sleek and spare, and the hotel restaurant appeared to be quite popular with guests.

Reviews.Title: “Awefull”
Reviews.Author: Jeff073
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommenced this hotel to anyone. We traveled with a group of about 30 people to a conference and were booked into this hotel. On day one people were asking for if we could possibly switch out our rooms to another hotel. Some reasons were reasonable, its not near a subway or any type of transportation, other reasons were down right disgusting, like I found a half eaten apple under the bed, or I can hear the guy in the next room peeing in the middle of the night. When our conference coordinator asked about letting some people switch out to another hotel we were told as we blocked booked we would be billed regardless. It didn't matter what the complaint was. On the last day we took a show of hands rather informally about what was wrong with the hotel. Nearly everyone had a problem with their billing system from charges for room service that was never ordered, as well as problems with their sensor system. When I complained that I never touched anything in the fridge they acknowledged that there was a problem with the system, and that they are glad I caught it. They point blank told the guy ahead of me who was a gold club or something VIP member of thier in house points system that his guaranteed upgrade was unavailable while telling the guy on the other side of me that they had comped him an upgrade to the club floor for their VIP members. We were all checking in together. That did make for an interesting conversation later. As a heads up beware of the shower heads, I'm not a tall guy 5 9 or so, those shower heads are low. You can scrunch under them, but don't stand up in a hurry. They had a business center but you couldn't use your own laptop to VPN to the office. I guess you could check your hotmail account and print something if you wanted to. The lobby was beautiful, but you had to get passed a maze of drunks trying to sneak in a smoke in the park like setting. If you think your getting a standard Westin hotel in this complex your mistaken, your getting dirty 2 star hotel with a beautiful lobby and room that don't quite live up to the Westin name brand.

Reviews.Title: “Really great service and staff make up for average rooms.”
Reviews.Author: mrsarb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and adult daughter. We were forced to extend our stay because of the volcanic eruption in Iceland and subsequent closing of UK airspace. We had two rooms at this hotel and found the sizes adequate but decor is a little bland and tired and showers are on the small side. However, rooms were very clean and comfortable and the air conditioning worked very well. The real stars of this hotel are the staff, who were excellent. Everyone we came into contact with was helpful in a pro-active way. We had to ask for teabags in the room rather than coffee but once requested the cleaner remembered for the rest of the stay and our room was cleaned even when we stayed in really late one day. The food was very good and the breakfast buffet covered most requirements and cooked to order items were very nicely done. The front desk were great to deal with and extremely helpful. They relaxed cancellation rules and check-out times due to the special circumstances (volcano) and even though they were pretty fully booked for the following few days they did find us space on a provisional basis since we did not know when we would be able to leave. This really took the stress out of a difficult situation. The only drawback to this hotel is the distance from Downtown Toronto but unlike most city hotels this one does have a lovely garden which was a nice bonus. The cabs offer a 40 buck flat rate but it can be less on the metre outside of busy traffic times and most accept cards. We never had to wait for one. Also, there is a subway station about a 15 buck ride away which costs 3 bucks into town and the trains were full of friendly Canadian commuters who actually talk to you! I would be happy to stay here again. If management monitor this site perhaps you could say thank you to the housekeeping persons covering the 16th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: lovewestin
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and enjoyed it immensly. The hotel has recently been renovated so everything was new and crisp and clean. Bathrooms were a little small in the regular rooms but we were upgraded to a deluxe room and the bathroom was great. We treated ourselves to a room service breakfast wich was served at the time we requested and was superb. On our 2nd morning we enjoyed a breakfast buffet which was beautifully laid out in the spacious bright main dining room. We enjoyed seeing the north end of the city which is a much more restful pace than the downtown hotels that we usually stay at. We were in town to see "Jersey Boys" which is just 10 min away. Stephanie at the front desk was great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazyguy
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to the Westin Prince in Toronto for a business trip. I remain very impressed with this hotel. The food is incredible and the breakfast buffet is very nice. The prices are what you would expect from a Westin, so no surprises there. The rooms are very comfortable and very quiet. Although you are quite a ways from downtown, the view from the upper floors is very nice with huge windows. The beds are also very comfortable. What I find odd is that although the hotel rooms appear to be remodeled, the bathrooms remain oddly dated although adequately equipped. This is the main reason I can't give this hotel 5 star honestly. I have to give kudo's to the staff at this Westin as they always recognize me as a platinum Starwood member and upgrade me without question. The concierge always accommodates our requests for car service and we are never disappointed. I really have nothing bad to say about the staff. They are friendly and welcoming...I always look forward to traveling to Canada since service staff are generally more accommodating than in the States.

Reviews.Title: “Close to North York General”
Reviews.Author: al-the-pro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel with our young child for one night recently. We needed a hotel close to North York General Hospital, that was the main criteria. I'ts a typical big city high rise hotel with 22 storeys and an impressive lobby. We had a 10th floor corner room with large windows and a nice view. These rooms have balconies with sliding doors but they are inaccessible. The sliding doors open only 4 inches to let some air in. It's a good safety feature since it's an older hotel and the railings might not be high enough. On the plus side our beds were very comfortable and we had a great flat screen tv. We were not disturbed by any other guests. On the downside we were charged $11 for regular outdoor parking. The washroom was very small but had an updated vanity and good lighting. The little fridge in the room was a cash minibar, so it was off limits for your own drinks or food. The snacks in the room were very pricey - you are billed if you even touch them, they have a special sensor. Stay back a few feet or you will pay $11 for a handful of peanuts! Overall it was very handy to get to the hospital first thing in the morning, but no special hospital rate was offered.

Reviews.Title: “Not much to look at from the outside...”
Reviews.Author: demodiva
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night recently on a business trip to Toronto. Our meeting was not right in the downtown Toronto but on the outskirts of the city so our hotel options were limited and we were happy to find rooms available at the Westin, always a pretty reliable hotel chain. We were a bit leery driving up to the hotel because it looks very run down from the outside, but after stepping through the front door, and seeing the modern lobby, our minds were at ease. The hotel itself does seem like and older structure and it almost seems like they pieced two different buildings together. There is a tower and then a small 2 or 3 story building. I stayed in the lower building and although my room was comfortable and clean, it was about a mile away from the elevators and lobby. Decent place to stay for business in that particular part of Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Great bed, good shower and top breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: TatianaEssex
Reviews.Content: I would have preferred to stay down town but the hotel is good and comfortable. The gym is small but adequate. Fine for business if your office is nearby but ended up getting taxis everwhere, spending nearly $150 a day. The breakfast is first class and helpful conceirge got us tickets for a Maple Leaf game! The Japanese restaurant attached to hotel, Katsura is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: bunny9975
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel to get away from downtown toronto. I was surprised how close to downtown this hotel was. I stayed there last year and was not impressed as it was under renovation. We travel twice a year and decided to go back and see what they had done. WOW WOW WOW the it looks like a totally different hotel. The staff very happy and smiled. The fireplace in the lobby, the front desk, the elevators and it keeps getting better. To the staff at the hotel keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “beautifully renovated hotel in park-like setting”
Reviews.Author: Eric451
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a corner room in the tower (almost all the rooms in the tower have corner windows). Newly renovated hotel, with larger than average rooms with large flat-screen TV, beautiful lobby, with tasteful restaurant/bar which offer great views of trees in their resplendent fall colors. My only complaints are: There is no operable swimming pool in the winter. Although there appears to be plans which are displayed in the lobby to rectify this. Also the grounds of the hotel could be better tended. The self-parking lot, which might be managed by a different company, was scattered with refuse during my three-day stay. I purchased the room from bidding on priceline.com and the price of the room was less than one-half the hotel's special internet rate - very reasonable. I would definitely stay at this hotel again as in its class it is the only one that I am aware of that is central to my activities and located on beautiful grounds. One really feels like you are in Canada, versus a generic hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms and service need better management.”
Reviews.Author: Queeneee
Reviews.Content: -Our "Heavenly Bed" was more bedeviled than angelic. The bed was made up each day using a flat sheet on the bottom rather than a fitted sheet. These sheets were woefully inadequate for the job. They are too small and the housekeeping staff simply leave off covering the bottom few inches of the mattress to compensate. When one climbs into bed, oneâ€™s feet and legs are laying directly on the bare mattress! -The mattress pad was never straightened or the elastic bands used to hold it in place at the corners so that it was always in rather a bundle in the middle of the bed. My husband and I were forced to completely remake the bed every night as best we could with the poor products provided. -We found holes in our sheets more often than not. Ironically, in the â€œWestin at Homeâ€� catalogue I can â€œbring the Westin sleep experience into my homeâ€� by purchasing the same ensemble used in the hotel. -I requested a "quiet room" for our stay. The reception agent at our arrival in fact, mentioned the request. However, we were given a room with connecting doors. Sadly, the front of house staff is completely uneducated that these doors offer no sound insulation and therefore we were privy to every late night phone conversation by the neighboring guest as well as his early morning alarm soundings and bathing habits. The staff really should know this is unacceptable. 5AM is not the time for guests to repack and move to another location because of staff misjudgments. -Returning to the room with a bottle of chilled wine one evening I stopped at the front desk and requested wine glasses. I had noted none in the room although they are standard in nearly all other hotels -- even the most basic. Staff ensured me they would send two glasses â€œright upâ€�. We waited and waited while our wine warmed. I eventually returned to the lobby, attempted to find assistance at the front desk and in the restaurant (none to be found) and finally in desperation, helped myself to two wine glasses from a table setting in the restaurant. An hour and 15 minutes later someone finally arrived with wine glasses. -While the room offered both an iron and ironing board, there are no available wall outlets where one might access electricity in order to use this utility. -We were charged $11 per day to self-park our car. We used many other downtown Toronto parking facilities during our stay. None charged more than a maximum of $6 for 24 hours. -The lighting in the rooms is extremely ineffectual - if not dangerous. The entry switches in our room controlled nothing, forcing us to either leave on the lights at all times or to grope across the darkened room to find a lamp control when returning each night. -The dim wall lamp in the dressing area is so completely ineffectual that one cannot find clothing in the closet or make use of the full length mirror. -Reading lamps are inadequate and badly placed to read in bed. -The coffee maker is of the "pod" type, however, it is being refilled with standard coffee pre-pack filters. Filter packs intended for a large pot of coffee, not a single cup. The resulting coffee is undrinkable unless one fills the reservoir numerous times with water and continues to press the function switch repeatedly. This is just silly. -Nightstands are cluttered with items that cannot be moved as they are wired into place with cable ties. I was unable to place my cell phone, book, reading glasses and a cup of water on the nightstand because I could not move the telephone base or clock onto the floor. I was also unable to move the sad little reading lamp nearer the bed. -The bedside clocks are unreadable in the daylight. It is impossible to know the time of day in a guest room if there is light in the room. The illumination is completely wrong. -The double-headed shower creates a massive stream of which a lady cannot help but get her hair wet. The hotel offers no shower caps. This means a guest cannot use the shower unless they have the time for a total hair redo. All in all, I would not stay at this hotel if given another choice. While the location was good for our particular needs on this trip, the hotel rooms were more in line with a mid-range hotel than that of a 5 star luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but tired”
Reviews.Author: Moffman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an overnight pit-stop on our way to the Niagara area with my wife and two young children. I am a frequent traveler and a fairly frequent patron of Starwood properties. I think, based on my experience, that the Prince isn't quite up to the Westin standards. The location is good, depending on what you're after. Just a couple of minutes away from the junction of the 401 and Don Valley Pkwy. Downtown is about 15-20 minutes away with free-flowing traffic. From my experience with rush-hour traffic, I bet it could take as long as 2 hours. I wouldn't stay here if I was planning to spend most of my time downtown. The beds are, of course, great. This is why we chose this hotel, and we weren't disappointed. The room itself was ok... nothing special. Nice TV if that's important to you... large, new plasma/LCD screen. The bathroom, however, is old and tired. Peeling wallpaper and some chips out of the vanity. Really, who cares, though, right? It's a bathroom and it seemed to be clean. The big issue I had was with lighting in there. There was a small, dim light over the vanity, and no light in the shower at all. Something should be done about that. The room had a balcony overlooking their back courtyard and the surrounding suburban / office park area. The balcony appeared to be falling apart... cracked plaster, weeds growing out of the slab, peeling paint, there was a discarded cigarette butt out there... and the sliding access door was nearly immovable, and I'm a pretty big guy. Maybe they're trying to discourage people from seeing the mess their balconies are. The common areas of the hotel (i.e., lobby and meeting room area) are tastefully decorated and well kept. We didn't eat in the restaurant or use any of the recreational facilities, so I can't comment on those, although the tennis court looked to be in decent shape. There's a small work area at the side of the lobby where you can plug in your laptop and sit down. One odd and moderately irritating thing was that the music piped into the lobby was club music... like house/techno/dance stuff. It wasn't loud, but it seemed very out of place, particularly at 0500 when I was up and working on my laptop. There is a charge for internet, which seems to be the norm at the "higher-end" hotels. Which brings me to my initial point. This property lacks the polish that a Westin property should have. I think it is more representative of a Sheraton brand hotel. Not bad, but don't overpay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, a memorable experience....”
Reviews.Author: Trvlpro15214
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Prince over a weekend since my niece was getting married nearby. Wow! what a difference renovations make! The lobby looks beautiful with the new decor and the surrounding property is lush and feels very nature infused compared to a lot of other toronto hotels. The staff was excellent in the restaurant, room attendants.....all very friendly, doormen (amazing service), Front desk people (Stephanie) at the Front Desk who really went out of her way to make sure we had a great stay she gave us an upgrade and asked a zillion questions since we weren't very familiar with the area but everyone had really good suggestions and seemed to geniunely care. We will definitely be staying here again. Only issue: we had to wait about 20min for service in the restaurant but it was VERY busy that morning.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, but a bit old”
Reviews.Author: amir_israel
Reviews.Content: I went to the westin prince on a business trip. The hotel was very good, nice rooms (although a bit old), the hotel was clean, the rooms were spacious, the bathroom was well equipped and clean. All that you can ask for when going on a business trip

Reviews.Title: “Compared to other Westins Iâ€™ve stayed at this was very poor.”
Reviews.Author: SeriousTraveller01
Reviews.Content: The service generally was very good and the food in the restaurant is above average for a hotel. The bedroom furniture is OK but the bathrooms are dated. Avoid a room on the 20th floor or above as you can hear the noise of the lift and air conditioning engines - perhaps their bearings are going. The floor in my bedroom (before I changed rooms) vibrated â€“ when not wearing shoes I could feel it vibrate and I could see the water in the toilet moving from side to side. The bedroom windows seemingly have never been cleaned â€“ they are a disgrace considering my room had a balcony. After leaving I found out my bill was wrong. No financial or other allowance was made for the Club Floor being refurbished. For a Westin it scores 1 or 2 out of 10. For any other hotel it would be 4 out of 10. Just remembered - I was surprised to hear a dog in the room next to me barking for an hour or so.

Reviews.Title: “It's below the Westin standard but this hotel still has a lot going for it!”
Reviews.Author: COCOFromOttawa
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Westin Prince two or three times a year to visit family in North Toronto. I always return thinking that finally, this will be the stay where the irritating wrinkles get ironed out and I will return home to write a glowing review. Sadly, the wrinkles persist. On the good side: the hotel is being renovated and the public spaces are lovely, open and modern. There's free internet access in the lobby. The Westin beds are always comfortable, bathrooms modern and the rooms super clean and mostly quiet. The park setting, outdoor pool (in summer), tennis courts and shuffle board give the hotel the feel of a resort and make it a great place to stay with kids. The Westin Workout gym is equipped to a very high standard (with cardio equipment, a BOSU, exercise balls and a variety of weights) and the Super Foods Breakfast menu offers lots of healthy choices (and not so healthy ones too!) . On the bad side: cranky and even beligerent staff members scattered randomly throughout the hotel staff cancel out the great impression left by the many friendly and competent staff members. The gym and pool area are consistently not cleaned and often not stocked with towels. The gym is often out of cleaning spray to clean equipment which can get pretty gross. Many rooms have not yet been renovated and are showing signs of extreme wear and tear. A new "automated" mini bar and room snacks system charges you for products, even if you just touch them or pick them up: a nightmare for parents of kids who are attracted to the shiny boxes of candies and other snacks. Dont request a pool towel, a kettle for your room or ask to have the shiny room snack display moved or turned off unless you're prepared for some unpleasantness from those cranky staff members I mentioned. A note to Westin Management: try staying at this hotel a few times, it needs more than a renovation to reach the high Westin standard!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a location that was perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: MoFloChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: The Westin Prince is a very attractive property located in a lovely park-like setting. It is well back from the very busy street in front, so noise is not a problem. It is one of a handful of hotels located in this part of the city (northwest of downtown) and of those, the only one I could find that is pet friendly. On the long weekend that we visited, the hotel was very quiet, which may explain why we were able to find such a favorable rate. Our second floor room had no view to appreciate, but it was extremely roomy and pleasantly decorated. It had a "heavenly" king bed and a work area that I would really have appreciated if I had been there on business. Not wanting to pay for Internet access, I was easily able to use the computer in the hotel business center. The $15+ charge for continental breakfast drove us away from the hotel restaurants, but there are a number of (mostly fast-food) restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, including several that deliver. In addition to a nice outdoor pool, there is a tennis court and a very nice workout room. We found the staff we dealt with to be very courteous. The only problem we had was a slow response to our request for the room to be serviced. A call to the housekeeping manager resolved this. Unlike many hotels in Toronto and elsewhere that accept pets, the Westin Prince do not charge a fee or ask for a deposit. You would definitely want to verify that this is still the case if you plan to visit with a pet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, skip the food”
Reviews.Author: hfromm
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very comfortable and the staff friendly. I love the showerheads, too. The food, however, was a big disappointment. I ate dinner at the hotel twice because of long days at work. The meals at the Seasons were atrocious in my opinion. Both dishes I selected were semi-liquid, not what I expected at all of risotto and paella. Salad was fresh and looked beautiful, but had far too much dressing for my liking. That was my bad for not requesting it on the side.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Pet Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kath_Ko
Reviews.Content: As I am writing the review, I am lounging in one of the guest rooms at the Westin Prince. This is my second and definitely not last stay. My coming back here for the second time in one month (I live in Toronto and about 15 minutes away from the hotel) implies great service, excellent amenities, cleanliness, friendly and helpful staff and the "ever-so-crucial" pet policy. The rooms are spacious, the beds really ARE heavenly, and the staff really does deserve the praise other guests have given them. The only less-than-perfect aspect of the stay is the washroom. Though the rooms have been renovated and are flawless, the bathroom seems to have been left the same for the last 30 years. The dated design isn't the downfall, it's the shower that's mounted so low, only people under 5'6 can comfortably use it, the bath itself shows significant wear and tear and the fixtures date back to before I was born. The first time I stayed, there was mold in the crevices of the shower, though it seems to have been scrubbed off. I did take a picture to present to you, my fellow trip advisor users, but it hardly seems fair to post the monstrous image since the issue has been resolved. The check in seems to be speedy for most. I can't give an objective opinion, as issues with my credit card company (sigh!) have come up both of the times I have checked in, resulting in a painfully long check in time. Though the concierge/valet was only too happy to look after my dog (she was waiting in an air conditioned car, as I didn't want her waiting/bouncing around during the check in process). All of the staff are very accomodating and a true pleasure to interact with. The check out was seamless, as they have a quick check out program and I was able to accomplish this within minutes, even with a large dog pulling me in every direction:). Now, for the pet policy. Upon our first arrival, my dog was greeted with a "heavenly" doggy bed, a set of bowls (they forgot this time, but we had it brought up to the room promptly....just missing one if the bowls) and a little bag the contents of which are too cute for words. There are two plastic capsules with doggy "potty" bags and a pair of plastic gloves! The was also a small paper tag to put on your pet's collar with the hotel name on it. The area surrounding the hotel provides for a scenic and pleasant walk with plently of bushes to smell and green grass to snack on. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone, who doesn't mind the dated washrooms and the location (about 20 minutes from downtown TO by car). I will certainly be coming back and am already checking rates for next week ;)!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on York Mills Rd”
Reviews.Author: allegraversace
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from a 5 day trip in Toronto. While the Westin Prince is not located downtown, it is conveniently located right by a bus stop (95) which takes you into the York Mills Station where you can take the train downtown. The hotel is contemporary and the lobby area is very nice. Upon our arrival, we were interested in finding hockey tickets. The woman who checked us in happily took the information and said she would look for tickets and call us in our room. That was a good way to start our stay! Hannah was very sweet and helpful. Unfortunately, there were no tickets available but she did try. My husband was not happy with the odor in the first room we were in (it wasn't smoke, I can't describe it) and Hannah moved us to another room. She even sent the new room keys up to us. The second room was much better. Our only criticism is that the rooms are fairly nice but the carpets are stained and bubbled. My husband is a carpet installer and had he had his tools with him, he would have fixed all of the bubbles. The carpet did take away from the room and we are not too picky. There is no reason to have what look liked bleach stains on the carpet. I read that there will be a renovation this year (the elevators will also be renovated). The shower was the best part. We both indulged and used the double showerhead. Try it, you won't use one showerhead anymore! The bed was comfortable but the pillows were just okay. There is a nice sized tv in the room but programming is limited compared to what we are used to. The restaurant in the lobby is great. We ate dinner at Seasons on our night of arrival. It was a bit pricey (we are not used to the multiple taxes, as well) but it was worth it. We ate there for breakfast each morning. I ordered off the menu (I recommend that granola pancakes) and my husband had the buffet twice, which was full of pastries, bagels, cold cuts, cheeses, an omelette station, pancakes--food galore. There are several restaurants located directly across from the hotel on the other side of York Mills. There was Kelsey's (we ate there and recommend), pizza, a greek place, Starbucks and Shoeless Joe's. Staff always tidied the room and respected the "peace" sign on the door. Our original sheets had a small hole on my side and a few days later I requested a linen change and there was a small hole on that set of sheets. Very odd! Amenities were provided-shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and even mouthwash. Nice white tea smell. There was a computer for use on the main floor. There should be a sign posted that if people are waiting to use it that there is a limit. Sometimes people need to be reminded of manners. While many people would probably pay for a taxi to get around, it is expensive and the transit system is really easy to use. There is a mall about 10 minutes away that has a new cinema with stadium seating. I do not recommend the Japanese restaurant located right by the hotel. They are really overpriced and most items were a la carte. Soup and salad is typically included in all Japanese restaurants that I have eaten in. There were 2 prix fixe options which were equally expensive ($68 or $110). Overall, staff was very friendly and our stay was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Westin... Functional Beauty”
Reviews.Author: rileigh15
Reviews.Content: Overall, great hotel. The modestly sized room had a large desk which is great for business travelers. Internet is NOT included, however. Of course we all know the beds and pillows at all Westins are fabulous (as you can even buy them!). Parking for this suburban hotel was also not included. However, the lobby, business center, bar, restaurant - all elegant without being intrusive. ONE COMPLAINT: The mini bar and snacks are all hooked up to a weighted tray... Which means that if you even nudge an item, you are charged for it - with or without opening it! Everything sits in plain sight - and if you like to read labels and SEE what you're purchasing like I do - you'll be very tempted to pick up the items. But don't fall for it! I also saw a sign posted on the unlocked fridge - even opening the fridge would mean a $25 cleaning fee - how silly!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a slightly out-of-the-way location”
Reviews.Author: Faience44
Reviews.Content: Our stay started on the wrong foot when we discovered that despite reserving adjoining rooms with a total of three beds, there were only two beds in the two rooms. The staff quickly upgraded us to two adjoining rooms of a better quality. The rooms were quiet, clean and comfortable, although the air was very dry. The bathrooms were clean, but the so-called Heavenly Shower was anything but, since it had apparently been designed for people about five feet six inches high. I had to stoop over to wash my hair. The quality of the food at breakfast was excellent. The hotel is a little out of the way in northern Toronto but a short taxi ride from the nearest subway station. We'll definitely stay here next time we viist Toronto rather than shell out big bucks for the often tired hotels downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At A Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: jstraw9
Reviews.Content: While I donâ€™t usually write a review I felt it necessary to write one for this hotel. Front desk personnel were very accommodating and extremely pleasant and caring. The facility is beautiful and spacious as all Westin Hotels, or at least the ones I have stayed. The staff was wonderful, the restaurants were great! When you are a guest in a city with 30 inches of snow on the sidewalks and -25 degrees for daily highs, having everything in one place is a big plus. For us business travelers, who miss staying at home, the staff does an extraordinary job to make you feel welcome and cared for. The 42â€� screen TV in the room was a bonus too, I believe these are in all the rooms. And besides that, the room was great! It was hard to believe that the hotel has been around for 30 years, everything looked NEW. My only complaint was that the gym needs another elliptical, but not really complaining as the tranquil setting made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “older hotel, very nice, great location, many renovations to date”
Reviews.Author: maxxtrax
Reviews.Content: in the city for training at nearby ADP offices, on Sheppard Ave. Nice quiet location, very easy to drive to, lots of good spots to eat nearby, a couple of popular rest./bars closeby (Kelsey's, Shoeless Joe's, Keg, St. Louis Wings, etc.) Most of the others in our training stayed further away at "better" hotels. The complaints of traffic, delays, etc, were numerous....I was able to drive to the office in less than 5 minutes, no issues... Got rate of $143 through the Starwood Preferred Guest site.....average for Toronto. would certainly stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not quite Westin standards”
Reviews.Author: ladybugx87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Prince for 1 night in January 2009. This hotel is fine but not what I expect from a Westin. Check in was OK but not great- it was kind of slow; not very polite but fine. My room was OK- it was somewhat outdated, making it seem dirty but it was clean. The bathroom is not a westin heavenly bath standard- there is a small separate shower that I didnt like one bit. The bed was great though! The internet in the room worked quite well. The gym is OK but kind of hidden and the employees did not give me very good directions. Check out was fine. I would probably stay here again but I would prefer a different Starwood property that lives up to its name.

Reviews.Title: “LOTS of construction and renovation going on...”
Reviews.Author: CarpeDiem02111
Reviews.Content: One of the WORST Westin Hotel experiences I've ever had. Not only is the building itself rather old with less-than-pristine elevators and hallways, but they are undergoing MAJOR renovation, with almost the entire lobby closed off for construction. Loud noises during the day, and very unpleasant to look at as you walk in and out of the hotel. Understandably, they've lowered their room prices to reflect this condition, but BEWARE of what you're getting into. The good news is that the rooms are decently-sized and beds are comfortable (as always for Westin hotels), so as long as you don't mind the horrendous construction going on, then this might be an option for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin Prince”
Reviews.Author: tzippy187
Reviews.Content: I came to Toronto to see a friend, and by chance this hotel was 10 minutes from her house ( I didn't plan that). The hotel was under renovation, but it did not effect our stay one bit. Check in was great, the agent was very friendly and helpful. I think her name was Christine? We had a room on the 21st floor and you could see downtown in the distance. The room was very clean, the bathroom was big with a seperate tub and shower. I loved their Heavenly bath set, it smelled great. The heavenly beds were very comfy. My friend who I travelled with is used to staying in Hostels and now she cant go back. It was very hard getting her up every day. We ate at the main restaraunt the first night and it was very good, the service was fast, but the restaraunt was empty. There was turndown service every night, they would leave a chocolate and weather forcast for the next day. I think those little things make a difference. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning every day. The TV was huge, I think 42'. They have self parking and valet. We self parked, the parking lot is right there. There is plenty of little restaraunts around the hotel (walking distance). Overall, the staff was very friendly, the hotel was nice and clean (looking forward to seeing it after the renovations) and we really enjoyed our stay. It is not that far from downtown, either. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: lilredfox
Reviews.Content: The Westin Prince WILL be a very nice hotel once they are done their renovations. The beds are awesomely comfortable and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The only troubles we encountered were from their renovations going on, which can not be helped but a token for the inconvenience would have been nice. The other thing that we found was that they "nickel and dimed" a person - a (what they call nominal) charge for internet service ($9.95 for a 24 hour period) - an expensive mini-bar that charges you automatically if you move items in the fridge - a pricey room service menu, although I must say that the food selection was excellent and the food was delicious! The view in their restaurant was awesome with the fruit trees and geese. Over all we had an okay stay, which would have been nicer if we came after the renovations were completed. Ohh, the location isn't very good either. It really isn't close to any shopping or attractions within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently nice”
Reviews.Author: hotelhound
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Prince for business 3 times in the past 6 months. Each stay has been enjoyable. Twice I have been fortunate to have a room with a corner balcony as well as a separate shower which I truly appreciate. The rooms are sufficiently sized and clean with a good work surface. Beds are very good. I appreciate the door separating the sleeping area from the entranceway and bath. Front desk and bell staff have always been extremely helpful although. I am surprised that at my most recent stay I was asked if I had ever stayed at the hotel before as I have been a SPG gold or platinum member for the past 10 years and as i said I have stayed 3 times in the last 6 months. The gym is small but nicely equipped --- I'm training for a marathon so the treadmill was very much appreciated. Room service is okay however the Pateo has an extensive buffet for breakfast with a variety of choices. Also, finally ventured to Katsura, the onsite Japanese restaurant, because it was too cold and too snowy to venture out 1 night during my last visit. I found the service was efficient and the food of a better quality than most teppanyaki style restaurants I have visited. I would certainly return if I go back to the hotel. The hotel is not entirely convenient to the downtown or lakefront areas so I'm not sure i would choose this location for a pleasure stay however when my work takes me to this area I look forward to the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KPTraveller
Reviews.Content: We spent a single night at the Westin Prince hotel, and were very happy with it. Check-in was fast, staff were friendly, and the room was very clean with great decor (white and taupe linens). The bathroom was small but extremely clean. It's designed in ceramic tile floors and bath tub. The shower was amazing with the "Westin Heavenly Bath" double shower head and bowed curtain rod. We found check-out to be a breeze, by using the in-room tv menu system. Just a quick tip for travellers - parking is extra so be prepared. We paid $11/day, which is fairly reasonable, given Toronto parking prices.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't do it.”
Reviews.Author: Vacation85
Reviews.Content: I was one of the people that read a bad review of this property and thought, "how bad can it be?" Well I will tell you. The price was attractive compared to other hotels in the city of Toronto. Driving up to the hotel, it appeared that this hotel was very old and run down. Going into it confirmed it. My first impression was that the rugs in the lobby were very dirty. We checked in and went to our room. The room smelled musty and was dark and dingy. This hotel is not a Westin, do not be fooled. The carpets were poor quality and the windows have not been cleaned in a long time. As I was leaving, I was asked how we liked the stay at this hotel. I told the person I spoke with that I did not like it. He looked at me with a perplexed expression. He then asked what I did not like and I started with the entrance way the rooms etc. He told me he does not usually look at carpets. Apparently he does not look at his spagetti sauce stained shirt either. Wow, I will never go back to this hotel. If you do go after reading this review don't say I didn't tell you so.

Reviews.Title: “What happened to the Prince?”
Reviews.Author: DisappointedKing
Reviews.Content: How very sad to see what has happened to this hotel. Lack of Service, no smiles, next time I will go back to the Westin Harbour Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “awesome, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: maestrowawa
Reviews.Content: I have to say that we were lucky to get this hotel at a very good price. What I didn't expect is that we seem to get a better room than what we bargained for. I reserved a double bed room for 2 days, and upon arrival, asked if they would honor the same price if we stay one extra night. They said yes right away. My parents and I traveled to Toronto to visit my 103-yr-old grandma who was briefly hospitalized at the North York General Hospital. The hotel is less than 5 minutes from it (drive), so it was super convenient. Our room was spacious, with 2 sided sliding doors and a balcony. The bedding was so good -- my mom is a light sleeper, but she slept so well for 3 consecutive nights! that says something. The room was always clean. I think our room must be a higher-end one (even though we didn't ask for it, at the price we paid, it doesn't seem right to give us a upgrade, either). It has a little hallway at the entrance, so people walk by couldn't see the inside of the room. We didn't notice that until one moring we saw our adjacent rooms where you can see their beds or TV stand while the doors were opened for cleaning. The staff was friendly. Though we called for some extra towels one day, and it took forever to come. On the last day of stay, I asked to have my linen changed, and it wasn't! That's about my only complaint. There were 3 phones in the room (1 in the bathroom), and multiple lines... we didn't get to explore what's there. I would've hoped that they don't charge for wireless internet. Even Best Westerns or Comfort Inns offer free wireless internet, I don't understand why Westin hotel can't throw that in with the price they charge for a room. And we did have to pay for parking at $11 a day. It's not so uncommon in a big city like Toronto. But we were very happy with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “3 star at best, needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: PWW090
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Prince in June on business. Just a little intro - I normally stay in 4-5 * places and have traveled extensively. I am quite fine staying in a Hampton or Best Western for the value, but when I pay top dollar, I do expect a lot. In the case of this Westin, I got very average. I have stayed in other 4 diamond properties many times and this hotel is simply not up to par. They have not renovated for many years and it is definitely due. Rooms were ok, furniture from Ikea. They did give me a decent upgrade (SPG Gold), so I assume this is a nicer room than average. If you need to be in this area, I guess this is the place to stay. But try to get a great deal, because after your stay, you will definitely think you paid too much if it was more than $150 or so.

Reviews.Title: “Wosrt Westin Experience Thus Far”
Reviews.Author: cabbage86
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, there was no doorman who greeted us. We entered the hotel to find the front desk, where the staff member looked like he just rolled out of bed, not impressed. i asked where the ATM was and he pointed to where the phones were, but the ATM had been moved, he didnt realize this at first, and when i asked the concierge he had no idea. after finding the ATM, which was across from the business centre, I asked to use a computer for only a few seconds to do an online bank transfer. the RUDE attendant in the business centre said that I was unable to use a computer because she was leaving...definetly not expected. throughout our stay were were not offered if there was anything else that they could do, or even if we enjoyed our stay. we were not recognized as SPG members, we called down to the service desk for extra bath amenities, which they delivered 50% of what we asked for, when we called back down, the phone attendant said that she "will just have to call her again", making it seem as if it was a big hassle. directions from the westin site took us down don mills road into the korean business district infront of a house...so it took us an hour extra to get to the hotel. There was no apology offered or sense of empathy, simply an "Oh, i guess someone is not doing their job!". So now they just pass the blame to the higher of their associates???? Over all this hotel has some work do to in terms of learning what 4 star customer service entails. Our whole experience was awful and we were recognized as nothing more than a room number walking in then out the front doors. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who is a person and likes to be treated like one...there are nice westins out there that i have experienced...I would just NEVER stay at this one again simply because of the service, facilities were nice, but service turned me right off

HotelInfo.Name: The Westin Prince Toronto
HotelInfo.Address: 900 York Mills Road, Toronto, Ontario M3B 3H2, Canada
